intro: Retiniphyllum cearense, commonly known as the Ceará retiniphyllum, is a rare flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland areas with well-drained soil. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
